data.author: Joey Tuong

changelog.release_notes:
/!\ Help needed! I've got a lot of requests for pebble classic and pebble time round versions, but I don't have the time. If anyone has any pebble.js skills, consider contributing to https://github.com/tetrapus/PoGoPebble

What's new:
- Night mode (Enable Backlight) in the settings menu enables the backlight when you lock onto a Pokemon. Best for night time pokemon hunting!
- Add a new setting to temporarily disable priority settings, for when you just want to catch 'em all.
- Infinite scroll lets you scroll past the end of the nearby list. Proper scrolling animations coming soon.

Fixes:
- Vibrate when the active pokemon enters the alert range, not just on first appearance
- Fix search bar so it isn't terrible
- Fix undefined settings before first config

Optimisations:
- Optimised more pokemon sprites

First release of the WatchApp version of PoGoPebble! The watchapp is identical to the watchface (PokeWatch), but gives you more control over navigating through nearby pokemon.

   - Press the middle button to lock a pokemon in place
   - Hold the middle button to dismiss a pokemon. You can reset dismissed pokemon by reloading the app.
   - Press the up and down arrows to navigate through the list of nearby pokemon. Navigating will automatically lock the selected pokemon.
   - Hold the up and down arrows to increase or decrease the priority of the current pokemon.
   - Shake the watchface to toggle between pokemon location, pokemon name, and current date and time.

data.description:
Hunt down nearby Pokemon!

See directions to Pokemon around you, get notified when new ones pop up, and represent your team!

Check out the settings page to customise your team and change your notification & filter settings.

In the app, use the up and down buttons to scroll through pokemon, and the select button to pin and unpin. Hold select to dismiss a Pokemon, and hold up and down to change the priority.

Shake your wrist to toggle between pokemon location, name, and current time.

If no pokemon are nearby matching your filters, will show your team colours. Check out PokeWatch for the watchface version of this app, sans scrolling.

PTR/OG Pebble support coming soon. See https://github.com/tetrapus/PoGoPebble/releases for pre-release builds for those platforms.

Suggestions, patches and bug reports very welcome!
data.title: PokeHunt
